page.title: 02Booth's Museum
page.content: It was 9.15 a.m. when our group set off. We were travelling to Brightons Booth Museum. We were all clutching clip_boards. Little did we know that the trip was to be long and tiresome. We had to walk. Our route took us past London Road and Preston Park Station. Finally we reached our destination. The first thing we saw were two stuffed bears standing in a glass case. Inside was a dark room filled with birds standing in glass cases on the wall. We were surposed to keep in several large groups, but everybody split up in twos or threes. If we could not find the case we wanted, a kindly faced gentleman directed us to it. Next stop was the insects. We were given an interesting lecture; mainly about butterflies and moths. The insects glistened as if still alive.s
